_header: Saint Stephen was a Jew and of Jews he came
Subjects: saints’ lives; Stephen, saint, life of
_description: Life of St. Stephen in the South English Legendary — couplets

BodAddC38.First Lines:
Seint Steuen was a iewe and of iewes he comeAnd thorou preching of
                    þe apostles turned to cristen dome…
BodAddC38.Last Lines:
…In þat chirche his holi bones were done in shryneNou god
                    for þe loue of seynt steuen kepe us fro helle pyne . Amen .

BodAsh43.First Lines:
SEyn Steuene was a wgiw & of giwes he comþoru prechinge of
                    þe apostles he turnde to cristendom …
BodAsh43.Last Lines:
…In þulke chirch his holi bones were ido in scryneNou god
                    for þe loue of seynt steuene vs saue fram helle pyne

Bod779.First Lines:
Seint Steuene was a Iew & of þe Iewes he com&
                    þorwȝ preching of þe a postlis cristindom he
                    nom…
Bod779.Last Lines:
…In þilke chirche his holy bonus were I don in chrineNow
                    god for þe loue of seint steuene schild vs from helle pyne

BodEngPoeta1.First Lines:
Seint Steuene was a Gyeu and of Gywes he comAnd þorwh
                    prechinge of þe Apostles he turnde to cristendom…
BodEngPoeta1.Last Lines:
…In þulke chirche his holy bones weore i do in schrineNow
                    God for þe loue of him schilde vs from helle pyne A.M.E.N.
BodEngPoeta1.Facsimiles:
Doyle,  I. A.,
                        ed.  
             The Vernon Manuscript. A Facsimile of Bodleian Library, Oxford, MS Eng.

          with an introduction by A. I. Doyle. Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1987. 
Scase,  Wendy,  and  Nick Kennedy, eds.  
             A facsimile edition of the Vernon manuscript: Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Eng. Poet. A. 1.
         Oxford: The Bodleian Library, 2011.

BodEngPoetc3.First Lines:
holy chirche in Ierusalem by werryddyn en eche sydeGodys dissiplis
                    were to sprad en þe lond well wyde…
BodEngPoetc3.Last Lines:
…Now god for þe loue of him ȝyf yt be þy
                    willeSchild ws now & euer from þe pine of helle

BodLauMis463.First Lines:
SEint steuene was a gyu & of gewes he com& þoruh
                    þe preching of þapostel he turned to cristendom…
BodLauMis463.Last Lines:
…In þilk chirche his holy bones were y do in shrineNou
                    god for þe loue of him shilde vs fro helle pine
BodLauMis463.Note: Two columns per page, one full-line, the other half-line.

BodRawPoe225.First Lines:
Seynt steuyn was a Iewe & of Iewes comeThourgh prechynge of
                    þe apostelys he turnyd to cristin dome…
BodRawPoe225.Last Lines:
…In þe chirche his holy bonys þei were doun in
                    schryueNow ihesu for seynt steuynis love saf vs alle fro helle
                    pyne

CULAdd3039.First Lines:
Sayne Sthephan was a Iwe & of þaire kynde he come&
                    þurgh prechynge of þe apostleȝ he turned to cristendomefful
                    wyde in lande he ȝode aboute & prechid of criste ful fasteIn
                    þe synagoge amange þe Iwes he come ate laste…
CULAdd3039.Last Lines:
…In þat kirke his haly boneȝ was þore done in
                    shryneNow god for sayne steuen lufe shilde vs fro hell pyne

CamCCC145.First Lines:
Seinte steuene was agyn & of giwes he comAnd þoru
                    prechinge of þe apostles turnde to cristendom…
CamCCC145.Last Lines:
…In þulke churche his holy bones were ido in ssrineNou
                    god for þe loue of seinte steuene ssuld us fram helle pine
CamCCC145.Editions:
D’Evelyn,  Charlotte,  and  A. J. Mill, eds.  
             The South English Legendary: Corpus Christi College Cambridge MS. 145
                and British Museum MS. Harley 2277, with variants from Bodley MS. Ashmole 43 and
                British Museum MS. Cotton Julius D.ix.
EETS
         o.s. 235 (1959), 236 (1956); repr. 1967: 2.590-4.

CamFitzMc128.First Lines:
SAynt steven was a Iewe and of Iewes comeAnd thrugh preching of the
                    Apostles he turned to cristendome…
CamFitzMc128.Last Lines:
…And ladden him without the toun and stoned hym anonffirst
                    thai strippet his clothes of and at a childes fete hem caste…
CamFitzMc128.Note:
Lines 1-36 only; catchword in lower margin of f. 36v is
                    ‘and for he couth do’.

CamMagPep2344.First Lines:
Seint Steuene was a giew & of gywes he comÞorw prechinge
                    of þe apostles he turnde to cristendom…
CamMagPep2344.Last Lines:
…Now god ffor þe loue of him ȝif hit beo his
                    willeShulde vs now & euere in pyne of helle þat we ne
                    spille

                    prechyng of þe apostles he turned to cristendom…
CamTCC605.Last Lines:
…In þulke churche his holy bonys ben ydon in schryneNow

Lam223.First Lines:
SAynt Steven was a Iewe & of Iewes comeAnd þurgh prechinge
                    of þe apostles he turned to cristendome…
Lam223.Last Lines:
…In þat chirche his holy bones ben done in shryneNow god
                    for þe love of him shylde vs from helle pyne. Amen

TokyoTak54.First Lines:
Seynt Stevene was a Iwe and of Iwes comeThorowe þe preching of
                    apostels he turned to cristendome…
TokyoTak54.Last Lines:
…In þe Church of Syon his holy bonys were putte in
                    shryneNow god for þe loue of hym kepe vs from helle pyne.
                    Amen.
